text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

As you can see, we are going to be making
something Sailor Moon related.

I got so many requests from you guys to do
something Sailor Moon related.

So I thought, hmmmm, let’s make some Transformation
Brooch Piñata Cookies!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: Sugar cookie
recipe, you can use

your favorite sugar cookie recipe, I’m using
an instant one because it’s

just really, really easy. And this recipe
calls for: 8 ounces of butter,

so just a stick of butter. And, 1 egg, you’re
also gonna need some flour,

so we can roll out our sugar cookies. Pink
food coloring dye, some star

candies for the middle of our piñata cookies,
because they were out of silver

crystals at the store guys, they didn’t
have any! And you’ll also need

some cookie icing, and a big mixing bowl,
with a mixer. I’m just going to be

using this hand mixer today, because I love
this thing!

Two circle cookie cutters, one should be larger
and the other one smaller,

and it should be able to fit inside of the
other cookie cutter. That’s important!

And then last, but not least, you’ll need
a baking tray to bake our cookies on.
Alright, let’s put it all together!

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
pour your cookie mixture into the bowl.

Then you’re gonna add one stick of butter,
and you’re gonna want to make

sure it’s room temperature, you want it
to be a little soft, so it’s easy

to work into the dough. Then you’re gonna
add your one egg. Then you’re just gonna

take a spoonful of flower and add it to your
mixture. Then you’re going to take your

mixer and mix the ingredients together until
everything is combined and smooth.

And then we’ll add a little bit of food
coloring dye. Now that our dough is ready,

we are going to roll it out and cut out our
cookie shapes. So the first thing you’re

gonna do is take a spoon, take a little bit
of flour, sprinkle it down on the table,

spread it around, make little circles. OK,
then we’re gonna take a handful of

our dough, it’s nice and pink! We’re gonna
sprinkle a little flower on top, and

then you’re gonna roll it out. And now,
we’re gonna cut out, each cookie is gonna

need a top, a bottom, and two middle pieces
for the piñata.

Then you’re gonna take the smaller cookie
cutter, and on two of them,

cut out the inside. So, just a reminder, these
4 pieces make 1 piñata cookie.
So you can make as many as you’d like. Now that we’ve got them cut out, we’re gonna

transfer them to the baking sheet with a little
spatula. And, we’re gonna put

them in the oven and bake them at 350 
for 5 minutes. But keep your eye

on them, because you don’t want them to
burn! Especially when you’re using

a non-stick pan, they tend to bake a little
faster.

Once your cookies are done baking, make sure
they’ve had plenty of time to cool.

And now, we are going to assemble the piñata.
So what you’re gonna want to do is take

one of the cookies, the full, round cookie,
and that will be the bottom. And then

you’re gonna take a little bit of cookie
icing, and you’re gonna do a thin

layer of frosting all the way around.
Then you’re gonna take one of the open

circle cookies and place it right on top.
Then you’re gonna add one more layer of frosting.
And then, we’re gonna add one more!

Ooooh! And now the fun part! You’re gonna
fill it with little candies, I found these

little star candies, but you can use anything that
you’d like. Then the final step, you’re

gonna put on a little bit of frosting, and put on
your top cookie. To make your cookie look like

the Crystal Brooch, the first thing that we’re
gonna do is draw an outline all

around the cookie, and a star inside. Now
that we’ve got the outline and the star on top

of the cookie, we are gonna add some more
details. You’re gonna take your yellow frosting

again, and draw a circle in the middle of
the star. Then, once you’ve got your circle

you’re gonna take these little candies and
you’re just gonna put one right at the top

in the center. Last touches! You’re gonna
take some pink decorating icing and I’ve

put anumber 1 tip at the end, so I’d have more
control. And I’ve got a bunch of little

candies here. You can use anything that you’d like,
like M&M’s or anything that you can find.

But you are gonna need red, blue, green and
yellow. The first candy we’re gonna put on is

red, and that is for Sailor Mars. So I’m
just gonna put a little frosting on top of the

candy, and we’re gonna stick it right above
our pink candy. Then you’re gonna get a

yellow candy, and it goes right over here
to the right. Next is a blue candy for

Sailor Mercury, and again you’re gonna put
it in this little corner. And last but not

least, a green candy outside of the star in
the last corner for Sailor Jupiter.
Ta-da!
Here are our Sailor Moon Brooch piñata cookies.

I hope you guys liked them, these were really
fun and easy to make. And look at these!
They’re so cute!

I will be posting lots of pictures of these
cookies on my Facebook, Tumblr,

Twitter, and Instagram, so you can check out
pictures there. And, if you guys make

Sailor Moon themed treats please send me your
photos, I love to retweet them and blog them.

I just love seeing your baking creations,
it just makes my day.
Alright, thanks again guys! Bye-bye!
Doo-dee-doo-doo-dee-doo-doo
Doo-dee-doo-doo
Doo-doo-doo-doo!
Doo-doo-doo-doo doo-doo-doo-doooooo!
